name: Sofitel London Gatwick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Wanted a good quality hotel close to the airport as we were arriving on the last shuttle and leaving a few days later on the first shuttle. The hotel didn't disappoint. Best location for north terminal with easy road access out of the airport. Will definitely use again on our next visit.
reviews.title: Family visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rooms are well finished and the beds are very comfortable.
reviews.title: Easy for early flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast was what you'd expect from a hotel of this quality.
reviews.title: A typical airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second stay at this hotel and I realy can,t find a bad thing to say.
reviews.title: Several Stays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and welcoming.The room we had was a good size with the most comfortable beds infact i wanted to take the bed home. This hotel is very clean and comfortable way to start and in our case end your holiday.Well done all the staff there you all work very hard and still manage a smile for your customers.
reviews.title: Sofitel Gatwick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located for a very easy walk into the North Terminal. The selection of restaurants is good with food of a good quality.
reviews.title: Great for Gatwick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Service levels could not be faulted and the room, although on the small side was adequate. Noise levels good for an airport hotel. Would stay here again if flying from Gatwick.
reviews.title: Hmmm...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sofitel prior to an early morning flight to Italy. Nothing wrong with the welcome; in fact it was rather sweet that I was asked if I'd stayed there before and upon my affirmation was welcomed back. The room was perfectly adequate for an airport stopover, however in spite of double-glazing, rooms at the front are subject to some noise from the shuttle that runs every few minutes between the South and North terminals. Dinner in the Cafe was reasonably good, but expensive, and whilst a previous reviewer's comment regarding feedback from the manger regarding pricing is noted, the whole of the Gatwick area is a captive market with artificially high prices as a result. The best thing about the hotel is the walkway directly into the airport and if you can find a deal on the internet, you can still stay for well under £100 per night.
reviews.title: Early Flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for staying at the night before an early flight at 06.00. It took all the hassle off travelling from home at 02.00 in the morning. The hotel was very comfortable , clean and location was excellent.
reviews.title: What a way to begin a Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to forget you are at an airport in this hotel.
reviews.title: Best hotel at Gatwick if you're flying from North Terminal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights whilst attending a conference there and I found it to be very nice indeed. Its very modern and the staff are helpful and the food was excellent. Certainly would recommend the hotel if you are on a business trip or between travelling trips.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I've stayed here many times, from when it was the Meridien (sold out to Sofitel about a year ago). It's hugely convenient, being a couple of minutes walk from the North terminal, and the check-out is pleasant and efficient.
reviews.title: The only place to be

likes.disliked: — There's a shop in the terminal where you can buy sandwiches/salads etc and drinks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are well appointed and comfortable, and the breakfasts are very good. There is a choice of restaurants, but I feel here there is a bit of room for improvement. I preferred the Meridien formula. I can't say the Oriental restaurant impresses me, but it's always full.
reviews.title: Location, location, location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a sports bar if you want to catch the match, otherwise a very pleasant bar area in the atrium, where you can have a drink and watch the panoramic lifts gliding up and down.
reviews.title: Covenient stay for Gatwick Airport

likes.liked: — Its location to the airport and car parking deal
likes.disliked: — High price of room service/restaurant meals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good value for money, try to get a deal that includes breakfast.
reviews.title: The convenience can't be beat...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being right next t the north terminal and connected bŷ the walkway it is very convenient.
reviews.title: DOES THE JOB!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: Rooms on the small side and a little to warm, but ideal for a pre or post flight night.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was able to check I early as our flight landed a noon and our onward connection was not till 0900 next day.
reviews.title: Very handy for the North Terminal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took train into London - we aware there are much cheaper options than the Gatwick Express trains which only take. 5 minutes or so longer!
reviews.title: It starts our holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Good to stop over when transferring flights! Especially long haul !
reviews.title: Quality airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: have stayed here numerous times over the past 5 years, for the night before a holiday.
reviews.title: have stayed numerous times - thumbs up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location for the terminal is excellent, rooms are very comfy and clean.
reviews.title: Very nice start to holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: as always, airport hotel prices of food and drink a little steep..... but hey.
reviews.title: Sofitel Gatwick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: would recommend
reviews.title: very good airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It really is a pleasant way to start a holiday particularly when you have an early morning flight. Park in long stay get bus to terminal then just walk though into hotel. Nice rooms, bar and restaurants and walk straight into the terminal to check in next morning. Makes an extra day of it and saves the stress of getting to Airport in rush hour. Thoroughly recommended.
reviews.title: Let down by front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We completely endorse the favourable reviews of this hotel. Arrived at 10 am and they were able to give us a room four hours before normal check-in - we had asked if this would be possible when we rang the night before and they said they would put in a request which they were then able to fulfil. They also upgraded us, without our asking, to a better room on the inside, so there was absolutely no noise. Room, beds, food, quality of service were all outstandingly good. We ate in their Chinese restaurant which was very good and had quick, friendly service.
reviews.title: Outstandingly good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, I stayed at this hotel for an early flight in the morning we booked a family room, what a size we had our bedroom with interconnecting room it was bigger than our bedroom, the beds where very comfy and big
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately stay there again
reviews.title: Excellent as always

likes.liked: — Convenience for check in at airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check out was very fast
reviews.title: Very convenient for airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Just had another overnight/parking package with the Sofitel, Gatwick and as always it was excellent.
reviews.title: Exactly the right send off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: We stayed here over night on our way to America. We arrieved at 4pm and were welcomed by a very nice American receptionist, who when she found out we were on honeymoon gave us a lovely room with the biggest bed I have ever seen! The room was clean and tidy and that bed was so comfortable. The hotel is in such a great place for overnight stays that even if it wasn't as nice as it was I would still have rated it well, but we felt very relaxed there and the big new water feature in the lobby is very cool! Highly recomended.
reviews.title: Great, friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: Stayed here overnight on Feb 9th ahead of our holiday in the Caribbean, albeit with some concerns due to recent poor reviews. This was totally unfounded since the work in the reception/atrium is now finished. We had a meal in the cafe, reasonably priced for an airport hotel. We found reception staff friendly, helpful and excellent English - perhaps recent reviewers should be aware that very few Brits staff London hotels.
reviews.title: A good stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: The rooms were above average size for a quality London hotel and we paid £120 for the room; it was clean and had great views over the airport without any noise; the rooms are a little tired and we were informed that this is the next stage in the renovation process. A key factor when we chose the hotel was the location, since you do not have to venture into a cold winter night as it is joined to the airport by an internal passageway. When you take into account the cost and unreliabilty of transport from hotels further afield, we considered this to be money well spent and have no hesitation in recommending it and would use it again.
reviews.title: Most Enjoyable Start to my Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed one night with my boyfriend - we had a 4:15am check in the next morning. Arrived around 7pm and went to the cocktail bar then on for dinner in the Oriental restaurant, service and ambience excellent in both. No sign of renovation - maybe they had packed up by that time. The room was nice and clean and wasnt too small.
reviews.title: Nice but small rooms, hotel under renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having nearly missed a flight once because of traffic on the motorway to Gatwick if we have an early morning flight we always use the Sofitel Hotel. Everything works well here the rooms are clean and comfortable you can relax and have a drink in the bar safe in the knowledge that you cannot possibly miss your flight. We used the oriental restaurant which was very busy with diners but to be honest i didn't rate the food much, too much fried food and gloopy sauces doesn't agree with me before a flight. Next time will try the brasserie.
reviews.title: Stay if you have an early morning flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is certainly convenient for morning flights and is a comfortable, and almost luxurious, way to start your holiday. Our room was a good size, modern, comfortable and clean. Everything you need is there- hairdryer, kettle etc, but fast wifi was only available at a high price. We ate in the Cafe Bar and thought the food was of average standard but overpriced.
reviews.title: Convenient, efficient and impersonal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Personally I do not much like hotels on this scale - the internal courtyard feels like you are in a city square surrounded by high rise apartments. I guess this works well in the airport context for creating a quiet place but is not really to my taste. Check in and out were very efficient but the whole place felt impersonal - maybe this is OK for what is really just a practical arrangement to make travelling easier.
reviews.title: expensive and small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: I stayed at the London gatwick sofitel a total of 3 times over 2 years and ever time the room has been spot less and the beds are so so comfortable, I struggled to wake up for my flight. Even though your on the airport you can't hear the planes with is good. There is also a park and stay service with is handy. Would recommend a nights rest here before a long trip. Tom
reviews.title: Most Comfortable bed ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second stay at this property, this time I decided to treat myself and stay in a suite, room 700 to be precise. The suite consists of two separate rooms, and two separate entrances. The bedroom with a very large bed, great bathroom and best of all the view over the runway from the large window, the living room is very big with a couch, chairs, television, dining table & chairs, one whole corner of the room is glass, this gives you a great view of the runway also, the suite overall is just over 50 meters square. The brasserie is pretty good with a two course meal for two with a glass of wine costing just over £70.00.
reviews.title: Great accommodation at Gatwick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our travel agent booked this hotel for us as part of a park and stay package, we thought for the quality of the hotel and the price we payed for a weeks parking (off site) it was excellent value at £120. The hotel is very nice and only a 2min walk to the north terminal via a covered walk way. Staff on reception desk were very helpfull and happy to assist. The room overlooked a road but you couldn't hear anything at all through the glazing (something a lot of city hotels should take note of). Lovely bedding and one of the most comfortable beds we have slept on. We did not eat at the hotel. We have already recomended this hotel to 3 of our friend and would have no hesitation staying again.
reviews.title: Very good stay before a flight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having never used an on site airport hotel before - we usually drive and park - this is perfect and we would use it again.
reviews.title: Good for what it is.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed on New Year's Day 07 for connecting flight the next day.
reviews.title: Hugely convenient and well equiped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easily the most convenient accomodation for access to either terminal. Two minute walk over bridge into North terminal. Train shuttle to South terminal very close. (Shuttle does allow for baggage trolley). Airport trolleys available at front desk.
reviews.title: If it wasnt for the Upgrade...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Standard room, not huge but very adequate, very clean, well insulated from outside noise, nicely decorated and comfortable. Found bed to be very comfortable. Mini bar, desk, internet connection (50p per minute/20 GBP per 24H) and the usual ammenities. Bathroom clean. Shower good. Good size TV with clear reception. Nice view of interior covered courtyard.
reviews.title: Check online for deals!

likes.liked: — The convenience of being right by the airport
likes.disliked: — Rooms don't quite live up to the reception and bar area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paid only 99 GBP from website. For this price would stay again without doubt.
reviews.title: Very convenient hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: If it wasn’t for the upgrade I would've walked out! The location is so convenient and walking into the expansive atrium was impressive and we looking forward to seeing our room. I booked it for a snip via Expedia and wasn’t expecting the most amazing space but we'd had a long day it was late and I being pregnant was exhausted.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have stayed here twice now, most recently in an Executive room with lounge access after a flight into Gatwick. The hotel is very conveniently located adjacent to the North Terminal, with only a short walk needed.
reviews.title: Dated, but very comfortable beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: There was a long queue for check-in, and despite me looking for an A-Club Gold desk, there was not one to be found. Asking the concierge was met with 'no desk today'. Helpful. I was offered my complimentary upgrade from Classic to Deluxe room, but took instead a 50% discount on an Executive room, for £30 extra (normal price £60).
reviews.title: snooty reception took no heed of our request

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room on the 8th (Executive) floor was well appointed, bright and airy, although no airport view due to those rooms being occupied. The room had a flat screen TV (the lower category rooms have old CRT TVs!), and plusher furnishings and amenities. The room was also larger, although was distinctly dated in appearance - the carpet was fraying and the chairs worn. My TV had a damaged screen, so I was promptly moved to a corner room, which was slightly more spacious. The bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: SOFITEL TO THE RESCUE !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Executive rooms come with a free minibar, although this has been stripped down to just mineral water, juice, beer and wine - no miniatures or snacks, which seems rather mean given the dire Executive lounge. Free internet in the room is also provided, but no wifi. This is really useless if not travelling with a laptop (and instead an iPad or iPhone-like device).
reviews.title: Hotel Room Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: The main advantage of staying here" is that it is connected to the North Terminal by a walkway and only a short monorail ride from the South Terminal. It's a pretty typical airport hotel, with a choice of restaurants and efficient, but faceless service. The bedrooms are adequate, but a little on the warm side (not great air conditioning). We dined in the Gatwick Oriental. Which is a best of Asia menu (even though most people in Asia would not recognise these interpretations). It knows it has a captured audience and is quite pricey for what you get. The hotel is a great choice for an early morning flight, or transfer stopover, as you don't have the hassle of airport hotel bus transfers.
reviews.title: Good location to terminals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for our one night stay, prior to flying to America the next morning, for its proximity to the North Terminal at Gatwick Airport. Our room was clean and the bed very comfortable. I had requested a "quiet" room as we had an early start and a long flight and naturally wanted to get as long a sleep as possible. We perfectly understand that this is not always possible and that you will always get noise in an airport hotel. However, we really didn't expect to be put in a room exactly opposite where building work was being carried out at the airport - this started at 7am with the diggers! Frankly, I was also surprised that I had to ask for hand towels and flannels (OK, I'm old-fashioned!) and that there was one small square of soap for both of us. Reading this you will think, (as I probably would) that I am "nit-picking" but, frankly, for a purportedly 5* hotel a bit off. The price we paid for the room did not include breakfast by the way, but once you are all checked in, you can breakfast at the airport very easily. For ease of getting to the terminal it can't be bettered and, should we fly from North terminal again, I would certainly stay there.
reviews.title: Superb for North Terminal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Being from Belfast if we take an early flight from London we have to fly in the night before. Being a family trip with my parents and two younger brothers we usually get a family room. We got a double room and adjoining room with three single beds.
reviews.title: Nice Stop Off
Great Stay!! Can't beat location.
reviews.text: Beds are comfortable, rooms are pristine and the staff are used to travellers turning up at strange times as it's connected to the airport. It's on North Terminal and only a short "train" ride to South Terminal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Only disadvantage is that there was only one bathroom between five people, so there was a little bit of a rush on the morning of departure.
reviews.title: Oasis in the madness of Gatwick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were due to fly out very early on 10 Nov from Gatwick so needed to stay the night before. This hotel seemed to be the best option on research as it is right in the ariport. It is very handy but it is not just a matter of stepping from the terminal inside the hotel entrance.
reviews.title: Great Hotel (but pricey)

likes.disliked: — Bar prices and bar waiter service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The check in was slow but it gave us time to wonder at the lobby interior - very modern and a great relaxed atmosphere. We noticed that the price quoted online did not include VAT and this was not obvious when booking!!! The lifts were plentiful and very fast and we were very impressed with our room. Nice decor, large size and great bathroom. No complaints!!!
reviews.title: Good but expensive
Fancy the putrid smell of old cigarettes? I don't..
reviews.text: Our group had a few drinks in the bar dowstairs - terrible service for the price you pay on the drinks bill! We then had a meal in the Ken Hom Restaurant - Fantastic food but again you wil pay for it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Overall nice hotel if you need to stay the night before and it means you do not have to mess around with transfers in the morning.
reviews.title: Brilliant Gatwick Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Good airport hotel Fast check in. Room ,clean and modern.
reviews.title: Good location, comfortable stay but don't take an executive room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Good location, reasonable prices considering the location. Room service was a little pricey but the food was excellent.
reviews.title: Quick stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: stayed here for 1 night before flying to usa, the sofitel is beautiful and so comfortable
reviews.title: a real treat
Mixed feelings
reviews.text: the room and its facilities are great.

reviews.title: Always Excellent
reviews.text: The coridors smell unpleasant and dirty probably due to the carpeting and the oriental restaurant was about the same standard as a poor chinese takeaway....not to be recommended. Otherwise we were quite satisfied. Room and bathroom were very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Always a pleasure to stay at this airport hotel. Bit expensive but well worth the extra the attention from the staff in all areas excellant.
reviews.title: Location is everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here before mid-morning flight. Location v. convenient (attached to N Terminal).Room comfortable and well-appointed. Good sound-proofing. Food expensive in all 3 outlets but Cafe offered better value than others. Alternative (unless you want a hot meal) is M&S in terminal (catering land side in N Terminal is pretty poor).
reviews.title: Good hotel, expensive breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Continental breakfast at £17.00 a head is extortionate and plays on a captive market; quality only so-so.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in staff appeared uninterested though may have been just tired towards the end of a day.
reviews.title: Sofitel is a great way to start your holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Best aspect is long-term parking deal which made the whole thing a bargain!
reviews.title: This hotel works great if you have a flight departing the next day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have had some pretty unpleasant experiences at airport hotels and so when I booked this I thought it would only be marginally better to drive up and park the day before than use an overnight taxi. In fact I was very pleasantly surprised. From the outside, the hotel is a pretty uninspiring box but it has an internal covered heated courtyard with the windows and the lifts looking in on it. One of the restaurants in this courtyard has the feel of a pavement cafe as a result. We ate there on one of the coldest nights of the winter and it was a brilliant way of getting into holiday mood for a warmer climate. The room was a standard hotel room, clean and comfortable. I was surprised that the airport noise was inaudible despite the fact that our window faced the airport runways. The food was good and the staff courteous and helpful though not always easy to understand.
reviews.title: much better than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was booked as part of a park and stay package. The only small grouse was that the number plate recognition didn't work at the car park entrance, but this only meant we had to talk to a perfectly helpful human being when we left.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our wedding night before flying out on Honeymoon, we were upgraged to a Supierior Room . The bed was really comfy and the bathroom had L'Occitane Toiletries in which was great. The room overlooked the Airport and wasnt at all noisy. The food/drinks are extremely expensive and service charges etc are also applicable on top so be aware. Staff at reception were helpful and we left our car here for the week and was superb as only a short walk from here to the North Terminal.
reviews.title: very comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Planning to go back to florida again in september so we have decided to stay at the sofitel for a third time wife fell in love with the hotel.
reviews.title: Great choice for Gatwick Terminals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Spent one night in a Club room prior to a flt. to ATL.
reviews.title: You pay for the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was a breeze. The room, although small by US standards, was very nice as was the bathroom. Very clean with nice bedding and amenities. The Club lounge is quite small but very nice. Had room service which was quick and tasty but very expensive.
reviews.title: not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location can't be beat if you arrive late at LGW or have to leave early. That is the only thing that justifies the price of this nice airport hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived about 10pm and had to stay over due to connecting flight the next day.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small as was the bathroom. The bathroom had one of those horrible 'cling to you' shower curtains rather than a separate shower cubicle.
reviews.title: Luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night prior to flying to Orlando.
reviews.title: Stunning Airport Stopover Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is a walkway directly from the North Terminal to the hotel entrance.
reviews.title: Very average airport hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The atrium is a great place to sit and "people watch" and the oriental retaurant serves delicious food. We had a fabulous meal here in the evening before our flight.
reviews.title: Very easy stay - perfect for 1 night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bedrooms are beautifully furnished, and the beds are amazingly comfortable. We were lucky to have a room overlooking the airport which is great if you love watching aircraft coming and going. Be aware that some of the rooms look into the interior of the hotel so do ask for an outside view if you would prefer this, although the interior rooms overloook the atrium which is not an unpleasant view.
reviews.title: Smart, modern hotel - excellent location - poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stay pior to an early flight, wow just so good and the walkway was a treat, we had an inside room over looking the courtyard great view, room not large but more than mett my expectations, we ate in the restraunt food and service was first class, the whole thing was just a great way to start my hoilday.
reviews.title: cant wait til next time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: 10 stars from me
reviews.title: Great Hotel !!!

likes.liked: — The very nice rooms and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I the last month I have stayed for 2 nights (in 2 different times) in the Sofitel Gatwick and I have really enjoyed my stay there.
reviews.title: Could not have wished for better!

likes.liked: — It was attached to North Terminal & they bent over backwards to accomodate your requirements
likes.disliked: — Just cant think of any down points!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a Executive Room in the 8th floor and it is really worth it. Since I arrived had the exclusive check in which made everything smooth and fast....the room was more nicer than I thought and I hardly felt I was in a Hotel.
reviews.title: Quality and convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a wonderful view of the airport and access to the Lounge so I could go to internet and have breakfast and some finger foods in the night. This really made a difference in my stay because I didnt have to stay long in the room f I didn't want to or dine by myself in a restaurant.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

likes.liked: — Great location - comfortable room - excellent restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here before a very early flight, rooms great and beds amazing. However check in staff were slow and not particularly helpful.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing, Dont book hotel with parking, very expensive and the parking is off site, you then have to get a bus back to the airport terminal and walk back to the hotel. For a hotel claiming to be 4 or 5 star this service was poor.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

likes.disliked: — The lift - had to use room card to operate and it was temprimental

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall ok but for the price could do better.
reviews.title: Another excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed at the Sofitel for one night compliments of Easyjet!! Stayed on the Executive (8th) Floor and was very impressed with the room. The room had the most comfortable bed and pillows I have every tried along with robe and slippers!! Toiletries were provided and a pack with cotton buds, nail file, etc. Tea and coffee were available as was a mini bar. Excellent stay and would thoroughly recommend.
reviews.title: Pricey but worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The restaurant meal provided for the Easyjet customers was mediocre, as was the breakfast, but as all was provided free of charge, we couldn't complain.
reviews.title: First rate experience

likes.liked: — The excellent service and the closeness to the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked a one night stay here in June, through the MOD discount website as a relaxing start to our holiday and for the free parking. We paid approx £130 for the room with 15 days parking.
reviews.title: Quiet Comfort

likes.disliked: — Breakfast included would have been nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is second to none, for the North terminal it's a short walk through an interconnecting tunnel. This allowed us to take advantage of night time check-in which was a queue free and easy process. Then we were free to relax.
reviews.title: comfortable and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Reception staff were very welcoming, porters extremely efficient and friendly. Check in was swift. The lobby areas had a nice buzz and were spotlessly clean and impressive. My son liked the glass lifts on both sides. We didn't eat at the hotel but there seemed a nice choice of bar/restaurant meals and the prices weren't too ridiculous. If we'd have needed to eat there, I'd have had no qualms. Piano bar seeme quite nice too.
reviews.title: A Must for Returning to US

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were clean, spacious with the highest, comfiest bed I have ever slept in. Fridge with water, tea, coffee and tv with range of world channels.
reviews.title: Great Start to a Holiday/Business Trip

likes.liked: — Clean, very comfortable. Excellently located for early morning/late night flights.
likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything bad at this time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My son had a z-bed which stretched across the picture window, so, propped up with pillows he had a great night spotting the planes landing and the terminal train going back and forth. (Probably the highlight of his holiday).
reviews.title: Wonderful !!!

likes.liked: — The Beds ,pillows,food,express check-out & location at airport

description: An established, four-star luxury hotel uniquely located within Gatwick Airport, Sofitel London Gatwick boasts world-class services and amenities, which include various dining options and extensive meeting and event facilities. The hotel offers eight-day or fifteen-day Park & Fly packages available at the airport the day before check in. The hotel is 30 minutes by Gatwick Express from central London and all its attractions.
